articles.headline: Defying Expectations in India, Modi Begins Key Trip to U.S.
articles.snippet: India’s new prime minister, Narendra Modi, offers himself as a metaphor for the India he wants to build — ambitious, confident and impatient with slackness of any kind.
articles.abstract: India’s new prime minister, Narendra Modi, offers himself as a metaphor for the India he wants to build — ambitious, confident and impatient with slackness of any kind.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEW DELHI — Almost as soon as Narendra Modi became prime minister of India, whispers began circulating of mysterious phone calls from his office, upbraiding startled officials for infractions like inappropriate clothing or chummy-looking public meetings with tycoons.

articles.headline: Security Experts Expect ‘Shellshock’ Software Bug in Bash to Be Significant
articles.snippet: The newly discovered bug could allow hackers to write code that could surreptitiously take over a machine, or run their own programs in the background.
articles.abstract: The newly discovered bug could allow hackers to write code that could surreptitiously take over a machine, or run their own programs in the background.
articles.lead_paragraph: Long before the commercial success of the Internet, Brian J. Fox invented one of its most widely used tools.

articles.headline: Made in the U.S.A., but Banked Overseas
articles.snippet: Multinational companies avoid United States taxes largely by claiming that much of their income is earned in countries where taxes are low or nonexistent.
articles.abstract: Multinational companies avoid United States taxes largely by claiming that much of their income is earned in countries where taxes are low or nonexistent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Imagine how frustrating it would be to have billions of dollars in cash but be unable to spend it as you wish unless you paid a large part to the Internal Revenue Service.

articles.headline: Drone Exemptions for Hollywood Pave the Way for Widespread Use
articles.snippet: The decision by the Federal Aviation Administration has implications for industries like agriculture, energy and online retailing.
articles.abstract: The decision by the Federal Aviation Administration has implications for industries like agriculture, energy and online retailing.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The commercial use of drones in American skies took a leap forward on Thursday with the help of Hollywood.

articles.headline: Yahoo Faces Moment of Decision, Again
articles.snippet: Its top assets are its remaining stake in Alibaba and 35 percent of Yahoo Japan, but analysts say the rest of Yahoo is challenged.
articles.abstract: Its top assets are its remaining stake in Alibaba and 35 percent of Yahoo Japan, but analysts say the rest of Yahoo is challenged.
articles.lead_paragraph: Yahoo, more than any other investor, should have benefited from the public market debut last week of Alibaba, the Chinese e-commerce giant.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and David Gelles

articles.headline: Clashing Goals in Syria Strikes Bedevil Obama
articles.snippet: On the third day of American-led airstrikes in Syria, it was increasingly uncertain whether the United States could punish terrorist groups without aiding President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.abstract: On the third day of American-led airstrikes in Syria, it was increasingly uncertain whether the United States could punish terrorist groups without aiding President Bashar al-Assad.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — President Obama said the American-led airstrikes in Syria were intended to punish the terror organizations that threatened the United States — but would do nothing to aid President Bashar al-Assad of Syria, who is at war with the same groups.
articles.byline: By Ben Hubbard and Anne Barnard

articles.headline: After a G.M. Recall, a Fiery Crash and a Payout
articles.snippet: Lara Gass died days after receiving her recall notice, in the first known fatal crash to have occurred after the ignition switch recall began. Her parents want to know why G.M. insisted her car was still safe to drive.
articles.abstract: Lara Gass died days after receiving her recall notice, in the first known fatal crash to have occurred after the ignition switch recall began. Her parents want to know why G.M. insisted her car was still safe to drive.
articles.lead_paragraph: She found the email early in the morning:

articles.headline: 3 Nations Offer Limited Support to Attack on ISIS
articles.snippet: Britain, Belgium and Denmark lined up behind the United States, agreeing to military operations in Iraq — but not in Syria.
articles.abstract: Britain, Belgium and Denmark lined up behind the United States, agreeing to military operations in Iraq — but not in Syria.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain, Belgium and Denmark lined up Friday behind the United States in its fight against the Islamic State group, agreeing to military operations in Iraq — but drawing a line for now against direct intervention in Syria.
articles.byline: By Stephen Castle and Steven Erlanger

articles.headline: Bill Gross, King of Bonds, Abruptly Leaves Mutual Fund Giant Pimco
articles.snippet: William H. Gross, who built Pimco into one of the largest money managers in the world and has been called the Bond King, has quit the firm he founded and will join Janus Capital.
articles.abstract: William H. Gross, who built Pimco into one of the largest money managers in the world and has been called the Bond King, has quit the firm he founded and will join Janus Capital.
articles.lead_paragraph: The bond king heard rumblings of a palace coup.

articles.headline: Hedge Funds Lose Calpers, and More
articles.snippet: The decision by the California Public Employees’ Retirement System to terminate its $4.5 billion hedge fund portfolio to makes it the biggest public pension to turn its back on hedge funds.
articles.abstract: The decision by the California Public Employees’ Retirement System to terminate its $4.5 billion hedge fund portfolio to makes it the biggest public pension to turn its back on hedge funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: Assets at hedge funds, once a niche investment vehicle for ultra-wealthy investors, hit a record $2.8 trillion this year. There are now more than 10,000 hedge funds and counting. Their steep fees have minted scores of billionaire managers and spawned not a few criminals in what has turned into a gold rush of the 21st century.

articles.headline: A Crisis of Faith in Bill Gross, Pimco’s Prophet of Bonds
articles.snippet: William H. Gross, for decades an investment guru, was undone by the increasing complexity of managing his ever-growing fund.
articles.abstract: William H. Gross, for decades an investment guru, was undone by the increasing complexity of managing his ever-growing fund.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, the investor William H. Gross was celebrated as his mutual fund ballooned in size, drawing investors attracted by its excellent returns.
